org.opendaylight.controller.sal.streams.listeners

Class ListenerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.sal.streams.listeners.ListenerAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, AsyncDataChangeListener<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.data.api.YangInstanceIdentifier,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.data.api.schema.NormalizedNode<?,?>>, DOMDataChangeListener

    public class ListenerAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements DOMDataChangeListener
    ListenerAdapter is responsible to track events, which occurred by changing data in data source.

    • Method Detail

      • onDataChanged

        public void onDataChanged(AsyncDataChangeEvent<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.data.api.YangInstanceIdentifier,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.data.api.schema.NormalizedNode<?,?>> change)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncDataChangeListener
        Invoked when there is data change for the particular path, which was used to register this listener.

        This method may be also invoked during registration of the listener if there is any preexisting data in the conceptual data tree for supplied path. This initial event will contain all preexisting data as created.

        Note: This method may be invoked from a shared thread pool.

      • Implementations SHOULD NOT perform CPU-intensive operations on the calling thread.
      • Implementations MUST NOT block the calling thread - to do so could lead to deadlock scenarios.
Specified by:
onDataChanged in interface AsyncDataChangeListener<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.data.api.YangInstanceIdentifier,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.data.api.schema.NormalizedNode<?,?>>
Parameters:
change - Data Change Event being delivered.
